title: How High Will he Jump?
question_text:
The height that a mountain biker achieves off of a jump is directly related to his comfort level with the jump. We will assume that conditions for regression inference are met.
Over his first $10$ runs at a newly designed downhill course, Will's jump height is found to increase an average of $4$ cm every time he goes off the jump. A computer output from this regression is shown below:
What procedure is appropriate for computing a $95\%$ confidence interval for the slope of the true regression line that relates Will's height to the number of completed runs on the newly designed downhill course?

choices.text:
Since the slope is a variable, a standard z
-interval will suffice.
